intro: Microspermum debile, commonly known as the slender spore moss, is a small, delicate liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure and small, elongated leaves that are often slightly curled. The plant produces microspores in small, stalked clusters called microsporangia, which are typically found on the upper surface of the leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Microspermum debile is often used in ecological studies to assess the health of moist, shaded habitats.
